summary: The document is an FBI identification form dated 04/24/98, detailing surveillance on John Rosselli, a figure linked to the JFK assassination. It records Rosselli's activities at the Friar's Club in Beverly Hills, his interactions with individuals associated with Twentieth Century Fox Studios, and specifics of the physical surveillance conducted, including observations of his movements and companions.
key_findings: The document is part of the FBI's records on the JFK assassination, indicating ongoing investigations or interest in related figures.
John Rosselli was under surveillance, with specific details about his activities and associations noted.
The document was classified as UNCLASSIFIED but released with deletions, suggesting some information was withheld from public disclosure.
The surveillance details include observations of Rosselli's movements, companions, and even the parking of a car registered to a close friend, Herman Spitzel.
